Meanwhile, François Forget and Sandra Duharcourt were both recipients of the CNRS Silver Medal, a distinguished honor bestowed by the French National Centre for Scientific Research. Also on this day, Adele K Morrison received the Malcolm Mcintosh Prize For Physical Scientist Of The Year, a notable accolade acknowledging her achievements in physical science.

Miller Medal, while Volker Mosbrugger received the Goethe Plaque of the City of Frankfurt. Claire Wilhelm was also recognized, winning the CNRS Silver Medal. Additionally, David Weiss was presented with the Davisson–Germer Prize in Atomic or Surface Physics, marking a notable achievement in his field.

Lieb received the esteemed Carl Friedrich Gauss Prize, a notable achievement in mathematics. Additionally, John Zilcosky was awarded a Guggenheim Fellowship, a prestigious grant that will support his future research and projects.

On Saturday, January 1st, 2022, several universities joined the Agence universitaire de la Francophonie, expanding the organization's membership. Sivas Cumhuriyet University, based in Turkey, became a member, as did the University of Biskra in Algeria and Lumière University Lyon 2 in France. Additionally, Paris-Panthéon-Assas University, another prominent French institution, also started its membership on the same day, January 1st, 2022.
On Saturday, January 1, 2022, several universities expanded their international affiliations. Chuo University and Wuhan University, as well as the University of Havana, all began their membership with the Agence universitaire de la Francophonie, a prestigious organization promoting French language and culture in higher education. Meanwhile, Kumasi Technical University started its membership with the Association of African Universities, further solidifying its ties within the African academic community.
On Saturday, January 1st, 2022, several universities expanded their affiliations as members of prominent organizations. The University of Texas Southwestern Medical Center and Kabale University began new memberships, with the former joining the Texas Library Coalition For United Action and the latter becoming a part of the Association of African Universities. Meanwhile, two international institutions, the University of Nîmes and Yeditepe University, started their memberships with the Agence universitaire de la Francophonie, further solidifying their connections within the global academic community.
On January 1st, 2022, several universities expanded their international affiliations. The University of Buea and Nelson Mandela University, as well as Oran 1 University, all became members of the Association of African Universities, strengthening ties with other institutions across the continent. Meanwhile, Jagiellonian University joined the Agence universitaire de la Francophonie, marking a new partnership with a global network of French-speaking universities.
On January 1, 2022, several universities expanded their international affiliations. Galatasaray University and Abdou Moumouni University, as well as Notre Dame University–Louaize, all became members of the Agence universitaire de la Francophonie, a organization that promotes cooperation among French-speaking universities. Meanwhile, Great Zimbabwe University joined the Association of African Universities, a separate organization that aims to bring together institutions of higher learning from across the continent. These new memberships are expected to foster greater collaboration and exchange among the universities and their respective organizations.
In a significant development in the academic world, several prestigious universities have joined prominent international organizations. The University of Balamand, University of Dschang, and Chernivtsi University all commenced their membership with the Agence universitaire de la Francophonie on Saturday, January 1st, 2022. Meanwhile, Makerere University also started its membership with the Association of African Universities on the same day, January 1st, 2022.
In recent developments, Accra Technical University joined the Association of African Universities on January 1, 2022, marking a new chapter in its academic collaborations. Meanwhile, F12 Platform's membership with Clubture came to an end on March 25, 2022. In another move, CY Cergy Paris University became a part of Eutopia European University on July 1, 2022, expanding its international ties.

On September 29th, 2022, Zaporozhye State began neighboring two new entities, marking a significant shift in its geographical relationships. The region started neighboring the Donetsk People's Republic, as well as Kherson State, on the same day. Meanwhile, Kherson State also initiated neighboring relationships with Russia and Zaporozhye State, with the latter being reported on Thursday, September 29th, 2022, further solidifying the connections between these entities.
The Russian invasion of Ukraine took a significant turn as it started in Kherson State on September 29, 2022. However, by the next day, September 30, 2022, the invasion no longer had the Donetsk People's Republic as a participant. Meanwhile, Zaporozhye State ceased to be neighbors with both Donetsk People's Republic and Kherson State on the same day, September 30, 2022, marking a shift in the regional dynamics amidst the ongoing conflict.
In a significant development, Kherson State is no longer neighboring Russia and Zaporozhye State as of September 30th, 2022. Meanwhile, the Russian invasion of Ukraine has ended in two key locations, with the conflict no longer present in the Donetsk People's Republic and the Luhansk People's Republic as of the same date, September 30th, 2022.

January 1st, 2022: Multiple Research Projects Lose Sponsorship The German Research Foundation has ended its sponsorship of several research projects as of today. Funktionen Und Molekulare Mechanismen Der Ap-1 Und Ap-2 Komplexe Und Ihrer Untereinheiten and Die Molekulare Funktion Von Tbx18 In Der Ureterentwicklung are among the projects that will no longer receive funding, with the sponsorship officially coming to a close on Saturday, 2022-01-01, or as also reported, Saturday, 2022-01-01, and January 1st, 2022. Additionally, two unnamed projects have also lost sponsorship from the German Research Foundation, effective the same date.
Friday, December 31st, 2021: Research Funding Sees Significant Changes Ahead of New YearAs the world prepares to ring in 2022, several research projects are bracing for a change in their financial backing, with the German Research Foundation set to end its sponsorship of multiple initiatives on Saturday, 2022-01-01. This includes the project "Plattformen Für Chemische Genetik Zum Studium Der Pflanzenbiologie", which will no longer receive funding from the German Research Foundation. Another project, "Spezifitätsanalyse Von Humanen Protein Lysin-Methyltransferasen Und Proteomweite Identifizierung Neuer Substratproteine", will also lose its sponsorship from the German Research Foundation on the same day. Additionally, the archaeological research focused on "Die Unterstadt Von Bogazköy-Hattusa" will be affected, as the German Research Foundation ends its support. A fourth, unnamed project will also see its funding from the German Research Foundation come to an end on Saturday, 2022-01-01.
On Saturday, January 1st, 2022, several research projects lost their sponsorship. The German Research Foundation ended its support for two projects: 'Biochemische Charakterisierung Und Regulatorische Eigenschaften Der Zusammenlagerungsmaschinerie Für U Snrnps' and 'Analyse Des Chemischen Reaktionsmechanismus Des Ozonabbaus Und Der Halogenfreisetzung In Der Polaren Troposphäre Basierend Auf Numerischer Modellierung Und Feldstudien', as well as an unnamed project. On July 25th, 2022, three regencies in Indonesia's easternmost region made headlines as they ceased to be located within the Papua province. Asmat Regency, Merauke Regency, and Mappi Regency all ended their affiliation with the province on the same day, marking a significant shift in the region's administrative landscape. While the exact implications of this change are still unclear, it is evident that as of July 25th, 2022, these regencies are no longer considered part of Papua province, with Asmat Regency and Mappi Regency confirming the end of their location within the province, and Merauke Regency also relinquishing its ties to the province on Monday, July 25th, 2022.

On Friday, July 1st, 2022, a significant expansion occurred within the Ischools organization as three prestigious institutions joined its ranks. Sheffield Hallam University Sheffield Business School, Syracuse University School of Information Studies, and University of Sheffield Information School all commenced their membership, bolstering the collective expertise and resources of Ischools. This coordinated effort marked a notable development for the organization, with Syracuse University School of Information Studies formally recording their start date as July 1st, 2022, while the other two institutions also began their affiliation on the same day, referenced as Fri, July 1st, 2022, and Friday, July 1st, 2022, respectively.
